summary.para: Contains directory information for a file. This structure is returned from the function when FileStorageInfo is passed in the FileInformationClass

remarks.para: If a volume is built on top of storage devices with different properties (for example a mirrored, spanned, striped, or RAID configuration) the sizes returned are those of the largest size of any of the underlying storage devices.

summary.para: Logical bytes per sector reported by physical storage. This is the smallest size for which uncached I/O is supported.
Bytes per sector for atomic writes. Writes smaller than this may require a read before the entire block can be written atomically.
Bytes per sector for optimal performance for writes.

This is the size of the block used for atomicity by the file system. This may be a trade-off between the optimal size of the physical media and one that is easier to adapt existing code and structures.
This member can contain combinations of flags specifying information about the alignment of the storage.

description.para: When set, this flag indicates that the logical sectors of the storage device are aligned to physical sector boundaries.
When set, this flag indicates that the partition is aligned to physical sector boundaries on the storage device.

summary.para: Logical sector offset within the first physical sector where the first logical sector is placed, in bytes. If this value is set to STORAGE_INFO_OFFSET_UNKNOWN (0xffffffff), there was insufficient information to compute this field.

Offset used to align the partition to a physical sector boundary on the storage device, in bytes. If this value is set to STORAGE_INFO_OFFSET_UNKNOWN (0xffffffff), there was insufficient information to compute this field.
